summary: This bill, the "Paula Bohovesky and Joan D’Alessandro Act," amends Title 18 of the United States Code to increase the penalty scope for crimes against children. Specifically, it focuses on section 3559(d)(1)(A), extending the existing penalty for crimes involving victims under 14 and adding that if the victim has not attained the age of 18 and the conviction involved a sexual offense, the penalty should be applied.
